marc:datafield.marc:subfield: Institute for the Study of the Ancient World,

datafield.subfield: "After neo-evolutionism, how does one talk about the pre-modern state? Over the past two decades archaeological research has shifted decisively from check-list identifications of the state as an evolutionary type to studies of how power and authority were constituted in specific polities. Developing Gramsci's concept of hegemony, this book provides an accessible discussion of general principles that serve to help us understand and organise these new directions in archaeological research. Throughout this book, conceptual issues are illustrated by means of case studies drawn from Madagascar, Mesopotamia, the Inca, the Maya and Greece."--

datafield.subfield: Wei Jin Bei chao mu zang de kao gu xue yan jiu /
WeiJin Beichao muzang de kaoguxue yanjiu
Beijing shi fan da xue shi xue wen ku =

Ben shu suo zhi de Wei Jin Nan Bei chao, zhu yao zhi Cao Wei, Xi Jin, Shi Liu Guo, Dong (Xi) Wei, Bei Qi (Zhou) shi qi, shi jian shang da zhi cong Huang chu yuan nian (220) Cap Pi jian Wei, zhi Kaihuang yuan nian (581) Sui dai, dan wei le bao chi yi xie zhong yao mu zang zi liao de yan xu xing, ci shi jian fan wei jiang hui qian hou lue you yan shen, di yu shang bao kuo jin tian bei fang di qu de Nei Menggu, Shanxi, Hebei, Henan, Shandong, Shanxi, Ningxia deng sheng, shi, zizhiqu. San shi ji zhong ye yi hou, lai zi Bei Ya de ge shao shu min zu fen fen jin ru Zhongyuan, jian li zheng quan, tong shi ye dai lai le jong yi yue Zhongyuan chuan tong wen hua he yi shi. Zhe xie wai lai wen hua yu yi Han wen hua wei zhu ti de Zhongyuan wen hua, jing guo jin 3 ge shi ji de hu xiang shen tou he hu xiang ying xiang, cu cheng le Zhongguo zhong gu she hui de bian qian, bing zhu jian wan cheng le you Han zhi Tang wen hua de guo du, jie yu Han Tang liang ge da yi tong wang chao zhi jian de Nan Bei chao shi qi (3-6 shi ji), Zhongguo she hui dao di fa sheng le zeng yang de bian hua? Bei fang shao shu min zu dai gei Zhongguo she hui shi me yang de chong ji? Han wen hua chuan tong shi ru he yu wai lai wen hua rong he bin xiang Sui Tang wen hua shan bian de ? Zhe xie dou shi Zhongguo zhong gu she hui yan jiu zhong de zhong yao ke ti, ye shi Zhongguo kao gu xue zhe chang qi zhi li si kao de wen ti.
魏晋北朝墓葬的考古学研究 /
北京师范大学史学文库 =

本书所指的魏晋北朝,主要指曹魏,西晋,十六国,北魏,东(西)魏,北齐(周)时期,时间上大致从黄初元年(220)曹丕建魏,至开皇元年(581)隋代北周,但为了保持一些重要墓葬资料的延续性,此时间范围将会前后略有延伸. 地域上包括今天北方地区的内蒙古, 山西, 河北, 北京, 河南, 山东, 陕西, 宁夏等省, 市, 自治区. 三世纪中叶以后, 来自北亚的各少数民族纷纷进入中原, 建立政权, 同时也带来了迥异于中原传统的文化和艺术. 这些外来文化与以汉文化为主体的中原文化, 经过近3个世纪的互相渗透和互相影响, 促成了中国中古社会的变迁, 并逐渐完成了由汉至唐文化的过渡, 介于汉唐两个大一统王朝之间的南北朝时期 (3-6世纪), 中国社会到底发生了怎样的变化? 北方少数民族带给中国社会什么样的冲击? 汉文化传统是如何与外来文化融合并向隋唐文化嬗变的? 这些都是中国中古社会研究中的重要课题, 也是中国考古学者长期致力思考的问题.
Beijing shi fan da xue shi xue wen ku
北京师范大学史学文库.

datafield.subfield: zhu bian Zhao Feng, Qu Zhiren.
Yelu da xue chu ban she,
Zhongguo wen hua yu wen ming cong shu

Ben shu yue 42 wan zi, zhu ti bu fen gong jiu zhang. Juan shou de liang pian wen zhang you Zhong, Mei si chou yan jiu ling yu de zhu ming xue zhe zhuan xie, zong lun Zhongguo si chou yi shu fa zhan de li shi bei jing, ren wen huan jing ji qi yan jin gui ji. Zhu ti bu fen you Zhong wai si chou xue jie yi liu xue zhe fen zhang zhi bi, ge zhang cong wen hua shi, yi shu shi de jiao du, dui zi xin shi qi shi dai zhi 20 shi ji chu Zhongguo li dai si chou de zhi zao ji yi, yi shu te si, sheng chan ge ju, zao zuo zhi du, yi ji zheng zhi, jing ji, wen hua, shi shang he yu wai yi shu yi qi fa zhan de ying xiang zuo chu shen ru qian chu de xi tong jie shuo. Zhong wai zhu zhe huan yi bu tong de shi jiao dui shu qian nian lai Zhongguo si chou guan fan chuan bo dui zhong xi wen hua jiao liu de gong xian zuo le min xi de chan shu.

本书约42万字，主体部分共九章。卷首的两篇文章由中、美丝绸研究领域的著名学者撰写，纵论中国丝绸艺术发展的历史背景、人文环境及其演进轨迹。主体部分由中外丝绸学界一流学者分章执笔，各章从文化史、艺术史的角度，对自新石器时代至20世纪初中国历代丝绸的织造技艺、艺术特色、生产格局、造作制度，以及政治、经济、文化、时尚和域外艺术对其发展的影响作出深入浅出的系统解说。中外著作者还以不同的视角对数千年来中国丝绸广泛传播对中西文化交流的贡献作了明晰的阐述。
Zhongguo wen hua yu wen ming cong shu

datafield.subfield: x, 535 pages, [15] leaves of plates (1 folded) :
ISAW copy is from the Library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.

Part 1. Travel 1817-1845 -- Disraeli and the Arabian nights -- 'We rode alone' -- 'Mystery hangs over Assyria' -- Adventures with the Bakhtiari -- 'I scarcely know which way to turn' -- Constantinople and Sir Stratford Canning -- Part II. Archaeology 1845-1851 -- visions of places underground -- they have found Nimrod himself! -- a firman without funds -- the Nestorians and Yezidis -- treated as a master-bricklayer -- the bull is taken to the Tigris -- Triumphal return to England -- the greatest achievement of our time -- the Winged Lions leave Nimrud -- Nineveh and Babylon -- Part III. Politics 1852-1869 -- visions of ambition -- where are you to stop Russia? -- into the cannon's mouth -- we looked to you as our champion -- India during the mutiny -- collared and harnessed -- Part IV. Diplomacy: Spain 1869-1877 -- Bismarck and the Spanish king -- they will kill him too -- revolutions give one a deal of work -- presumptuous Dons -- Part V. Diplomacy: Turkey 1877-1884 -- Gladstone a mere vulgar pamphleteer -- Disraeli makes Layard ambassador -- the amiable Sultan Abdul Hamid -- Turkey is fighting our battle -- it is Poland over again -- the Russians threaten Constantinople -- Negotiations for Cyprus -- Another quarrel with Gladstone -- the very heart of chaos -- Gladstone recalls Layard -- Part VI. Retirement 1884-1894 -- Art and writing in Venice -- the thieving of Assyrian antiquities -- what many have attempted you have done -- a hundred years later.

datafield.subfield: ISAW copy is from the Library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.
The prologue -- The laws -- The epilogue.

"Hammurapi's Code is the best available mirror of Mesopotamian society and it is therein that the importance of the code lies. ... The impact of ancient Mesopotamia on the West was enormous, and the value of the code consists of its being our chief single source for reconstructing the sociology of Old Babylonia. Although only a specialist in ancient history is competent to judge the extent of Mesopotamian influence in the West, nevertheless the general reader can compare the legal, social, and commercial ideas of Old Babylonia with our own." -Introduction, p. 3.

datafield.subfield: Yin Zhou jin wen ji cheng shi wen /
Zhongguo she hui ke xue yuan kao gu yan jiu suo bian.
Xianggang Zhong wen da xue Zhongguo wen hua yan jiu suo,
ISAW copy is from the library of Edward Louis Shaughnessy.

"Ji cheng shi wen" an zhao "Ji cheng" shi ba fen ce shun xu hao pai lie, fen fei liu juan suo shou lu de ming wen zi liao, cong Yin Zhou dao Chunqiu, Zhanguo shi qi, ge lei qing tong qi, nian dai xia xian duan zhi Qing tong yi yi qian, ye bao kuo Song dai yi lai ge gong si zhu lu, hai nei wai zho yao bo wu guan he ge di de xin chu tu de, yi ji shang wei fa biao de fa jue he cai ji pin, shi jian xia xian zhi yi jiu ba wu nian. Qi zhong guo chuan shi zhu lu qi wu wei cun zhen, cuo wu jiu zheng, shi yi bu xian shi zhun qu de xian Qin qing tong qi min wen shu ju hui bian.
Yin Zhou jin wen ji cheng.
Zhongguo she hui ke xue yuan.
Yin Zhou jin wen ji cheng shi wen.
[Xianggang] : Xianggang Zhong wen da xue Zhongguo wen hua yan jiu suo, 2001
中國社會科學院考古研究所編.
香港中文大學中國文化研究所,
《集成释文》按照《集成》十八分册顺序号排列，分为六卷所收录的铭文资料，从殷周到春秋、战国时期，各类青铜器，年代下限断至秦统一以前，也包括宋代以来各公私著录，海内外主要博物馆和各地新出土的，以及尚未发表的发掘和采集品，时间下限至一九八五年。其中对传世著录器物去伪存真，错误纠正，是一部翔实准确的先秦青铜器铭文数据汇编。

近出殷周金文集錄二編 /
本书是《殷周金文集成》、《近出殷周文集录》出版以后，陆续发现的殷周金文新资料的汇编，全书按按器物性质分乐器、蒸煮食器、盛置食器、酒器、水器、杂器、兵器七大类，每大类下再按具体器形分若干小类，每小类中按字数由少到多为序排列。

datafield.subfield: Jin chu Yin Zhou jin wen ji lu /
Liu Yu, Lu Yan bian zhu.
Yin Zhou jin wen ji lu
ISAW copy is from the library of Edward Louis Shaughnessy.

Ben shu shi "Yin Zhou jin wen ji cheng" 1984-1994 nian chu ban yi hou, lu xu fa xian de Yin Zhou jin wen xin zi liao de hui bian, zi liao zhu yao qu zi guo nei wai bao kan za zhi yi ji you guan kao gu bao gao, tong qi tu lu deng, ben shu shou qi de shi dai xia xian duan zai Qin tong yi yi qian gong fen jiu qi. Quan bu zi liao an qi lei bian pai, da lei ru yue qi, li qi, bin qi, za qi deng; xi lei ru zhong, nao, duo, ling, ding, li, gui deng. Mei lei qi zai an zi shu duo shao pai lie. Ben shu mo fu you "Ming wen ren ming suo yin", "Ming wen di ming suo yin", "Ming wen guan ming suo yin" he "Ming wen zu ming suo yin" yi ji "Qi wu chu tu di biao", "Qi wu xian cang di biao", "Qi wu shi dai fen qi biao" he "Yin yong shu mu ji jian cheng biao".
Jin chu Yin Zhou jin wen ji lu.

本書是《殷周金文集成》1984-1994年出版以後, 陸續發現的殷周金文新資料的匯編, 資料主要取自國內外報刊雜誌以及有關考古報告, 銅器圖錄等, 本書收器的時代下限斷在秦統一以前共分九期. 全部资料按器类编排, 大类如乐器, 礼器, 兵器, 杂器等; 细类如钟, 铙, 铎, 铃, 鼎, 鬲, 簋等. 每类器再按字数多少排列. 本书末附有《铭文人名索引》, 《铭文地名索引》, 《铭文官名索引》和《铭文族名索引》以及《器物出土地表》, 《器物现藏地表》,《器物时代分期表》和《引用书目及简称表》.

marc:datafield.marc:subfield: Institute for the Study of the Ancient World,

datafield.subfield: ba-ʻarikot Menaḥem Doreman, Shemuʼel Saferai ve-Menaḥem Śteren.
In memory of Gedaliahu Alon, essays in Jewish history and philology
Title on added t.p.: In memory of Gedaliahu Alon, essays in Jewish history and philology.

Gedalyahu Alon, meʼet Y. Be'r. -- Tsiyonim beyograʼfiyim. -- Baʻayot ba-hisṭoriah shel ha-lashon haʻIvrit, meʼet Y. Bel'o. -- Leʻinyan shemotaṿ shel 'Elohe haʼavot, meʼet Sh. Yavin. -- Kayin ṿe-Hevel, meʼet B. 'Openhaimer. -- Shimʻon ben-Sheṭaḥ ṿe-Yan'ai ha-Melekh, meʼet Y. Efron. -- Perushim, tseduḳim ṿeʼasiyim be-pesher Naḥum, meʼet D. Pelosar. -- Divre Sṭra'bon ʻal ha-Yehudim, meʼet M. Shṭern. -- Maʻamad haʼezraḥut shel Yehude Kirini, meʼet Sh. Apulbum. -- Beḥinot ḥadashot le-baʻayat maʻamado u-maʻasaṿ shel Raban Yoḥanan ben Zakai leʼaḥar ha-ḥurban, meʼet Sh. Safrai. -- Shesh milim mi-Kohelet rabah, meʼet Sh. Liberman. -- Ḥuʼan Ramires mayurdomus shel ha-Ḳardinel Frantsisḳo Himenes de Sisneros, meʼet H. Bainaʼrṭ. -- Kaṿim le-temunat ʻolamo ha-ruḥani ṿeha-ḥevrati shel keranisṭon Yehudi beshalhe yemai ha-benayim, meʼet H.H. Ben Sashon. -- Bibliyograʼfiyah shel kitve Gedalyahu Alon (p.292-294).
Hebrew with English added title page.
ISAW copy is from the Library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.
In memory of Gedaliahu Alon, essays in Jewish history and philology.
בעריכת מנחם דורמן, שמואל ספראי, ומנחם שטרן.

גדליהו אלון, מאת י. בער. ־־ ציונים ביוגראפיים. ־־ בעיות בהיסטוריה של הלשון העברית, מאת י. בלאו. ־־ לענין שמותיו של אלהי האבות, מאת ש. ייבין. ־־ קין והבל, מאת ב. אופנהיימר. ־־ שמעון בן־שטח וינאי המלך, מאת י. אפרון. ־־ פרושים, צדוקים ואסיים בפשר נחום, מאת ד. פלוסר. ־־ דברי סטראבון על היהודים, מאת מ. שטרן. ־־ מעמד האזרחות של יהודי קיריני, מאת ש. אפלבאום. ־־ בחינות חדשות לבעיית מעמדו ומעשיו של רבן יוחנן בן זכאי לאחר החורבן, מאת ש. ספראי. ־־ שש מלים מקהלת רבה, מאת ש. ליברמן. ־־ חואן רמירס, מאיורדומוס של הקרדינל פרנציסקו חימנס די סיסנרוס, מאת ח. ביינארט. ־־ קווים לתמונת עולמו הרוחני והחברתי של כרוניסטון יהודי בשלהי ימי הביניים, מאת ח.ח. בן ששון. ־־ ביבליוגראפיה של כתבי גדליה אלון (p.292-294).

marc:datafield.marc:subfield: Institute for the Study of the Ancient World,

datafield.subfield: The historical prologue of the Hittite vassal treaties :
an inquiry into the concepts of Hittite interstate law /
Bar-Ilan studies in Near Eastern languages and culture
ISAW copy is from the Library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.

The so-called "Historical Prologue" section in the Ancient Near Eastern treaties is characteristic of "vassal treaties" and documents pertinent to political subordination. It is known so far mainly from Hittite documents, where it serves to present a set of legal arguments, justifying the imposition of obligations on the subordinate party, and depriving that party of the ability to contest the validity or legality of the subordination. As such, it constitutes a potentially rich source of legal conceptions and rules pertaining to the interstate law of the period, and particularly to the law of the treaty of the Ancient Near East - a source whose potential was hitherto unfortunately ignored due to a misinterpretation of this section's role in these documents. Taking as its starting point the premise that the function of this section was juridical and that it was addressed to the divine judges, this study attempts to unfold the legal considerations that underlie the wording of some 20 examples of the "historical prologue".--Dust jacket.
Bar-Ilan studies in Near Eastern languages and culture

datafield.subfield: The wonders of ancient glass at the Israel Museum, Jerusalem /
Yael Israeli ; [translated from the Hebrew and edited by Nancy Benovitz].
ISAW copy is from the Library of Hayim and Miriam Tadmor.

Glass is mentioned only once in the Bible, in the book of Job. He lists glass together with gold, precious stones, and other materials of great value. This collection highlights the wonders and charm of this remarkable medium.
